result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Jay Harris Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

*Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation ordered as to Case# 15CF000704 & 15CF003348.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To any sentence with credit for Zero days served; Huber privileges for employment.  Good time credit may be earned.
*No Contact Ordered as to the victims with probation sentence on Case#  15CF000704 & 15CF003348.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jay Harris Sr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  6  MONTHS  in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for Zero days served; Huber privileges for employment.  Good time credit may be earned.

-  No Contact Ordered as to the victims with probation sentence on Case#  15CF000704 & 15CF003348
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation ordered as to Case# 15CF000704 & 15CF003348.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Michael Jay Harris in court with Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Michael Jay Harris in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Counts  2, 3, 4, 5 and 6   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Michael Jay Harris not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.
Defense counsel arrived late in court; Court in trial on an unrelated case.  Case could have been spun to another court, other courts were ready and available to hear case, defense counsel left the courtroom and did not re-contact the court until after 4 p.m., cases could no longer be spun to another court.

Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Michael Jay Harris not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned for Plea and Sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Michael Jay Harris not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Jay Harris in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  No offer and discovery received.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant picked up a new case.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael Jay Harris in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however Branch 21 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Jay Harris in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney just appointed.  Attorney needs time to meet with her client.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
-Per transfer approval for global resolution.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record,  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing. Defendant has a pending felony case #15CF704 in Branch 21 (Honorable Judge Brash). Per transfer approval, case transferred to Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jay Harris in court, attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales unavailable for today's proceedings.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-25-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jay Harris in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/26/15 @ 1:30pm
